verses.text: 烏西雅王去世那年，我看見主坐在高高的寶座上，他的衣裳垂下，充滿聖殿。

words.note: Lit. 'depart the world'
Reduplication for emphasis, 'very high'
Formal or archaic term for clothing

verses.text: 在他上面有撒拉弗侍立，各有六個翅膀；用兩個翅膀遮臉，兩個翅膀遮腳，兩個翅膀飛翔。

words.note: To stand in attendance, serve

verses.text: 他們彼此高呼著說：「聖哉！聖哉！聖哉！萬軍之耶和華！他的榮光充滿全地。」

words.note: Archaic exclamatory form, 'O Holy one!'
Literally 'of myriad armies'. Connects 'hosts' to Yahweh.

verses.text: 因呼叫者的聲音，門檻的根基震撼，殿也充滿了煙雲。
那時我說：「我有禍了，我滅亡了！因為我是個嘴唇不潔的人，又住在嘴唇不潔的人民中間，又因為我親眼看見了大君王萬軍之耶和華。」

words.definition: woe is me, I am ruined
words.note: Idiomatic expression, 'Woe is me!'
Literally 'of myriad armies'. Connects 'hosts' to Yahweh.

verses.text: 有一個撒拉弗飛到我面前，手裡拿著燒紅的炭，是用火鉗從祭壇上取來的。

words.note: Transliteration of the Hebrew word for a type of celestial being.
Indicates a descriptive phrase or emphasizes the manner of action.

verses.text: 他用炭沾我的口，說：「看哪！這炭沾了你的嘴唇，你的罪孽就除掉，你的罪惡就赦免了。」

words.note: An exclamation often used to draw attention to something important, frequently in biblical texts.
Refers to both the sin itself and its negative consequences.
Emphasizes the moral wrongness of an act.

verses.text: 我又聽見主的聲音說：「我可以差遣誰呢？誰肯為我們去呢？」我說：「我在這裡，請差遣我。」

words.note: A respectful title for God or Jesus in Christian texts.
Commonly used in the Bible for sending prophets or apostles.

verses.text: 他說：「你去告訴這子民，說：『你們聽了又聽，卻不明白；看了又看，卻不曉得。』

words.note: Archaic or formal term for 'people' or 'a nation's populace', often used in scripture.
Literally 'to know and get it'; implies comprehension.

verses.text: 你要使這子民的心思遲鈍（「遲鈍」直譯是「蒙脂油」），耳朵不靈，眼睛昏暗，免得他們眼睛看見，耳朵聽見，心裡明白，回轉過來，得到醫治。」

words.note: Here a translation of a biblical idiom implying spiritual insensitivity.
Here meaning 'covered with' or 'to be dulled by'.
A biblical idiom for spiritual dullness or insensitivity.
In this context, spiritually dull or unresponsive.
Figuratively, to be spiritually blind or unable to perceive truth.
Often used in a biblical sense to mean repentance.
Forms a directional complement with '回轉'.
While common, in this context it refers to spiritual healing or restoration by God.

verses.text: 於是我說：「主啊，這要到幾時為止呢？」他回答說：「直到城鎮荒涼，無人居住；房屋空置無人，地土廢棄荒涼。

words.note: Refers to God or Christ in biblical contexts.
Refers to the physical land, often with religious/historical significance.

verses.text: 耶和華要把人遷到遠方，在這境內必有很多被撇下的地土。

words.note: Transliteration of the Hebrew name for God, YHWH.
Refers to abandonment, often with divine judgment implied.
Often refers to the promised land or national territory.

verses.text: 境內剩下的人，雖然只有十分之一，也必被消滅。但正如栗樹和橡樹，雖然被砍下，樹的餘幹還存留在那裡。這聖潔的苗裔，就是這國的餘幹。」

words.note: Figuratively, refers to a surviving remnant of a people or nation.
Refers to a chosen or surviving line, often with a prophetic meaning.
In biblical context, often refers to the nation of Israel or God's kingdom.
Figuratively, refers to a surviving remnant of a people or nation.
